With 7 alive, it'll take four to lynch. Deadline is in (expired on 2013-08-19 22:30:00).

Vanilla Townie PM:
You are an ordinary townperson. Your only powers are those you came into the game with. You win when there are no threats to the town (mafiosos, werewolves, serial killers, etc.) alive and there is at least one town-aligned player alive.

Rules stolen from Gammagooey who took them from Faraday and Vi and modified them. Modified somewhat by me.
--Big overall stuff
1) The site-wide rules apply, please read them and don't do anything stupid.
2) Unless it is explicitly stated in your role PM that you can do so, do not talk about this game outside of the game thread.
3) Do not quote any communication you have with me, the moderator of the game. Depending on the circumstance, you may be able to paraphrase things I have sent you (such as a role PM). Use common sense and if you are unsure feel free to ask me via PM. Trying to use timestamps of PMs to try to discover alignments will get you modkilled, as will posting any quicktopic you may have or copy+pasting from it.
4) Don't be a dick.
5) A modkill will occur if a player has broken a rule that compromises the integrity of the game or blatantly breaks rules despite warnings. I will kill you, change your alignment to Neutral Survivor, and take the day to night. The only exception is if a member of the mafia intentionally tries to get himself modkilled to help his faction by taking the game to night- this will keep the game at day.
6) Play to achieve your win condition.
7) I reserve the right to forcibly replace players if their rule infractions indicate they should no longer play the game but aren't severe enough to be killed.

--Voting, Lynching, and deaths
8) The following voting formats are acceptable: vote: ac1983fan, Vote: ac1983fan, VOTE: ac1983fan. Abbreviations and misspellings are okay too, so long as I can figure out who you're voting. If it's at all ambiguous it will not be counted.
9) Unvotes aren't necessary when changing votes, but are nice. They can also be used to remove your vote from wherever it currently is.
10) I will try to post one vote count every day, with more if necessary because of a lot of vote changes. If you want an extra one ask for it and I'll be happy to give you one. If one is wrong point it out in-thread and I'll correct it as soon as possible.
11) A lynch will occur when a player achieves 50% +1 of the votes. When this has happened, any subsequent votes and unvotes will not be counted, and the game will enter twilight. Night will begin as soon as I have declared the lynch.
12) You may vote for a no lynch if desired. If a majority of the players in the game vote for a no lynch, the game will progress to night without a lynch.
13) Once you're dead, you are dead. Do not post in the thread until the game is over, except for one contentless "bah" post. It must be made relatively soon after your death.

--Activity & Deadlines
14) Try to stay active- if you can no longer keep up with the thread due to real life issues send me a PM and I'll begin looking for a replacement.
15) Prods will be issued after 72 hours without posting. If you're due for your 3rd or higher numbered prod and you've received at least one prod in the current or previous game day I'll replace you instead. Players may request a prod on another player too if I forget or you want it done faster than the regular votecount.
15a) If you do not post in thread within 48 hours of being sent a prod, I will begin searching for a replacement.
16) Things come up in life, if you need time off for something, please let myself and the players know in-thread for V/LA purposes. I will be flexible, but if you can't be here for a significant amount of time I will replace you.
16a) I will permit a temporary replacement if you will be gone for a period of longer than 1.5 weeks, but you must find your own replacement.
17) Deadlines for each game day will be 2 weeks.
17a) Day 1's deadline will be 3 weeks from the start of the confirmation phase.
18) In the event of a deadline being reached without a player gaining a majority of votes, there will no lynch.
19) Nights will have a 2 and a half day (60 hour) deadline. If you fail to send in a night choice, you will automatically default to 'no choice' for that night, and you will do nothing. You may send in an action in advance if you think you won't be there for the actual night period. The night scene may not exactly be up after 60 hours, but give or take an hour or 10 and it will be.
20) Deadlines may be extended if multiple players are on V/LA over the time deadline would expire or replacements have been needed throughout the day or in other circumstances. They will not be extended if nobody is posting or for other similar reasons.

--Other Stuff
21) I call dibs on purple font. Don't use it.
22) It's more than possible I've missed a rule or haven't completely covered something. Don't try to exploit it, or you will be modkilled.
23) I reserve the right to add more, or modify existing rules at any time. If this happens, I will let everyone know.
24) Flavour in any modscenes is only flavor. It will not give insights to the alignments of any player in them and you can understand all of the mod-info from the deaths below any flavor that is given.
25) Don't use codes or cryptography to gain an advantage for massclaims or other situations. Using size tags or other BBCode to hide things is also not allowed. As an exception you May use breadcrumbs or other simple methods of hiding information that use small changes or indications in otherwise regular posts. If you've got a question about what's acceptable PM me before using it.
26) If you don't agree to follow these rules then send me a PM before the game starts and I'll find a replacement for you.
27) Have fun, and DFTBA!
All role PMs are out.  Day 1 will start when 11/13 confirms are in.

11/13 players have confirmed. Day one start!

In post 49, BP wrote:A mislynch on d1 is NOT better, IN MY OPINION, because I much rather, as I said, analyze the kill's info based on day behaviour that analyzing day behaviour

OK the key to knowing if you should lynch or nolynch on D1 is the number of players in the game.

In mini normals always assume one scumteam, one scum team one kill per night so;

13->12 on N1 so D2 12 people alive; assume no vig etc and this leads us to a situation where we have to nolynch AGAIN later down the line this means we have lost a lynch over where we would have been if we had just lynched Day 1. Therefore lynching D1 is infinitely better than Nolynch in 13man game.

Do the full math if you don't understand why there is a lost lynch; losing a lynch is very very bad for town.

In a game with 12 players; its more debatable. Theoretically nolynching there D1 gives the PR's an extra night while making the odds as low as possible for scum to shoot the PR's N1. This means that you have more information for the first lynch which would be on D2. Now the scum will mostly kill the stronger townies on the N1 this actually will balance the information gain from PR's slightly. The information gained from NK analysis is well... its actually GOOD when you have a lot of meta on everyone in the game but in a game with this playerlist (-1)? wouldn't do much at all. Then there is the fact you can lynch D1, Nolynch D2 and be in a similar situation but I have had enough explaining now as this is a 13p so this is less relevant.
How does having an even number of players make us lose a lynch-opportunity? I don't get it.

Both scenarios; 3 scum no scum lynches Bolded show mislynches.
Lynch D1;
13->11->9->7-> scum win

mislynched 3 times lost on 4th

Nolynch D1;
13->12->10->8->scum win
(you can nolynch a 2nd time here with no detrimental effect)

mislynched twice lost on 3rd.

This is very basic theory.

First of all, thanks. Really. That *was* nice. However, I understand all that. I do. That's all relative, tho, given that you're taking it as granted that the info from N1 would be completely useless, which I don't think to be the case. Ever. After the reactions from the RVS it is infinitely better (IMO, again) to analyze the info from the N1 kill choice than to rather lynch randomly on Day 1. Cuz that's what we'll be doing, unless Baezu is the most obvious scummyman on the website, and his scummates are not smarter than him. As I've said, I've played scum a couple o'times and L1 is most often a mislynch that leads nowhere, because scummies will know how to cover it up by killing off the right player. See what I mean?

Day 1 -> Mislynch :: Night 1 -> Scummies will cover it up pretty well given the Day 1 BW's and whatnot, which leads to Day 2 -> Mislynch again, which leads to Night 2 -> ANOTHER dead townie. HOPEFULLY, no important informative PR's will be killed and they'll have enough tells to start pointing fingers at actual scumpeople in a way that puts the rest of the Townies behind the bandwagon.

This is how things mostly went off-site. I'm not very sure about this one in specific, but I rather not play with these odds. Ofc, what's above is not written in stone, but odds point to that. No lynch on Day 1 is thus better not only because it obviously guarantees no mislynch, and cleans up the info from Night 1 kill choice info.

ANYWAYS, this is the reasoning behind my no-lynch theory. You're all welcome to disagree.

Also, I don't necessarily play this way. I still want to wait for a few days and see what the player's are all about. If I find a good-enough scum-scented playa, I'll vote to lynch him no problem.

What is, is I WOULD like to know the other player's response to these questions that arose. Yes?

In post 59, Grimgroove wrote:I personally think daytime activity (votes, posts, hammers, ...) are much easier to analyse than night kill-decisions.


I disagree wholeheartedly. During the night, the mafia have to act together. They choose as a team which player's interactions get analyzed. If someone is fingering the entire mafia team, they may leave them alive over the player that has fingered all civs to try and get mislynches. They may do the opposite for supreme WIFOM. During the day, mafia can deliberately not interact or choose to interact in certain ways to deceive. If a mafia gets pegged, then they can dig to keep suspicion away from any teammates. A night kill has no deception; that player is killed. No matter what, that player is getting analyzed the next day, and the lynch that follows generally reveals why mafia made that night hit.

Elyse: +1

Ztife: +2
Beazu: 0
Sunny: +1
Darthe: -1
Grim: -1
Sal: +1
Red Dragon: +1

It should be recognized that this method of analysis is not quite salient because you cannot fully quantify such a thing, however these reads are relative to the players overall expression of their views of the players. Thus the points given at the beginning of the post should reflect the players views with the latter examination and links demonstrating specific reasons. With that in mind, Ztife should be shown as NachoPops strongest town read and NachoMa as definitive scum.

That's actually not true.

I intended to pretend to be a "newb" either way, so that people wouldn't have any inclination of who I was. I wanted there to be no alt guessing (you see alts in games all the time that are out about being an alt and players will badger them and alt guess the entire game; myself being a culprit)

My intention was to join a game as a newb, pretend for a bit I didn't know the site culture to make it believable, and then quickly play at the level of proficiency I wanted to play at (the intention was to be less hostile and narcissistic than usual). When I rolled scum I didn't like it, but I planned to follow that same plan but from the scum side. I was already run up and I couldn't just MAGICALLY do proficient town things if I wanted to be viewed as a beginner, so I was forced to do a stupid newbslip. I figured it was all right (but blurred lines) specifically because people ALWAYS as scum bullshit things like not knowing the NK, or other fabricated townslips. ASIDE from the fact I wanted to start as a newb, I faked a stupid townslip, and this was something that occurred to me as a tactic after the decision to come in as a newb.

Here's the issue. People are allowed to join games and pretend to be from offsite when they're in a town slot. However, it was considered dishonest since it was a scum slot. I didn't pretend to be a newb in order to have an advantage as scum, I pretended to be a newb to have people see me with a fresh point of view and to leave me alone.

I don't know, I DO feel icky for faking it, and I felt really on the fence AFTER the fact (I didn't think about it being potentially wrong until after it had happened, I was frankly in overdrive to push me out of danger and I did that).

Another issue was that it ruined my plan to pretend for maybe 10-20 pages I was crap and then become more efficient, because you lie as scum, and therefore I had to go from being a terrible lying player to a better lying player instead of lying for a fraction of the game and then being the new truthful personality I wanted to test out

I don't know, that was my thought process and the conflicts I had when I thought it over, and the reason I was on the fence about it being right or wrong

But if it is considered wrong to pretend to be a newb scum it should be considered equally as wrong to pretend to be newb town. I think that's stupid, because having a fresh start is nice sometimes. Additionally, another point for why it isn't necessarily wrong to fake being newbscum is because newbscum DO get coached into stupid townslips in games and players DO have to judge the slips to be truthful or not. It wasn't like the slip was gamebreaking and impossible to decipher because RD did decipher it.

It's a little frustrating because I'm not sure there's any real way to tell whether a player is faking being new, and if you assume that they are faking it then you will usually end up being wrong and lynching incorrectly...

But whatever, in terms of "stupid bullshit that can happen in a mafia game" this is not even more than like a 3 out of 10
The point is someone can be new and pretend to be "newer" than they even are or can be coached. I wouldn't consider that wrong, and it's something I'm skeptical about in any game.

If you had been an actual newbie or someone new to the site, its different and completely fine its lame, really lame, but they can't do it again and so they got their cheap win but now they have meta.

This doesn't apply to you. You got your cheap win and now you can go and do it again on another alt.

This isn't a grey area.

I suppose it isn't clear; it is bad for the game as a whole if lots of people were doing this sort of thing on alts. Do you want to be playing in games where people are pretending to be newbies constantly? no, neither do I.

Want the big picture? genuine newbies suffer for it because when that happens they get lynched when they shouldn't.

So, where do we draw the line? do we say well a couple people a month can do it but then the 3rd person is criminal!!! Apparently.
